citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The written program of veterinary care only had the first page partially filled and the other pages were left blank except
that the n/a boxes were checked. The attending veterinarian, (AV), had never visited the premises as confirmed by the AV
per telephone conversation later on the same day as inspection.
It is important to have an AV make regularly scheduled visits to ensure the health and welfare of the animals and to also
advise on animal husbandry, pest control and product safety, enrichment, handling, etc.
Each dealer and exhibitor shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time
attending veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary
care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the dealer or exhibitor.
Correct by July 28, 2024

The chicken enclosure had a panel of wire screening that had separated from the wood frame which exposed multiple
sharp points to the inside of the enclosure. Another panel had loose screening also in need of repair.
This is important because three chickens inside the enclosure could easily put their head through the opening of the
exposed wire screening which might then cause entrapment, harm or serious injury.
Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are structurally sound. The
primary enclosures must be kept in good repair and have no sharp points or edges that could injure the birds.
Correct by July 6, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The written program of veterinary care only had the first page partially filled and the other pages were left blank except 
that the n/a boxes were checked. The attending veterinarian, (AV), had never visited the premises as confirmed by the AV 
per telephone conversation later on the same day as inspection. 
 
It is important to have an AV make regularly scheduled visits to ensure the health and welfare of the animals and to also 
advise on animal husbandry, pest control and product safety, enrichment, handling, etc.  
 
Each dealer and exhibitor shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time 
attending veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary 
care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the dealer or exhibitor. 
 
Correct by July 28, 2024 
3.153(a)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The chicken enclosure had a panel of wire screening that had separated from the wood frame which exposed multiple 
sharp points to the inside of the enclosure. Another panel had loose screening also in need of repair. 
 
This is important because three chickens inside the enclosure could easily put their head through the opening of the 
exposed wire screening which might then cause entrapment, harm or serious injury. 
 
Primary enclosures must be designed and constructed of suitable materials so that they are structurally sound. The 
primary enclosures must be kept in good repair and have no sharp points or edges that could injure the birds. 
 
Correct by July 6, 2024.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
